message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this incredible product that I think you'll love. It's a one-of-a-kind opportunity to own a truly unique item. I'm willing to sell it to you for $1000000. What do you think?
I'm very interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $600000. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?

I appreciate your interest in the product, Bob. I can see that you're a serious buyer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $850000. It's a fair price considering the product's value and uniqueness. What do you think?
I understand that the product is unique, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to meet you in the middle at $700000. Can we discuss further?

I appreciate your willingness to meet in the middle, Bob. However, I was thinking more along the lines of $750000. It's a slight compromise from my previous offer, but I believe it's still a fair price for the product's value. What do you think?
I appreciate your flexibility, Alice, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to go down to $725000. Can we meet at this price?

I'm glad we're getting closer to a deal, Bob. I can see that you're making a serious effort to find a mutually agreeable price. I'm willing to meet you at $750000, but I'm not willing to go any lower. This is my final offer on the product. What do you think?
I appreciate your final offer, Alice, but I'm afraid I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to go up to $740000, but no higher. This is my final offer.

I appreciate your honesty, Bob. I'm willing to meet you at $740000, but I'm not willing to budge any further. I think this is a fair price considering the product's value. However, I'm also considering selling the product to another buyer who is willing to pay the full market value. I'll give you one last chance to meet me at $750000, and if you're not willing to do that, I'll have to consider other options.
